p: Commercially available cis-platin had as expected superior potency against HeLa cells with a low IC 50 value of 25 μg/mL. However, D. chryseum-derived samples showed high potency as well through effective inhibition of the growth of HeLa cells. Significant dose-dependent growth inhibition percentages and low IC 50 values were exhibited: 49.79% (210.5 μg/mL) for DCT and 46.97% (226.5 μg/mL) for DCW while the cytotoxic activities of wild and in vitro samples were nearly the same, being slightly better in the in vitro-grown samples (Figures 2– 3).
